metadata.title: CVE-2022-0171 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. The existing KVM SEV API has avulnerability that allows a non-root (host) user-level application to crashthe host kernel by creating a confidential guest VM instance in AMD CPUthat supports Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
